result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).
- Defendant to pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation imposed as to Case# 22CF01421.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of probation imposed as to Case# 22CF01421.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC).

With credit for 120 days; TIME SERVED.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the probation sentence as to Case# 22CF01421 and if no new crimes are committed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather

records.addlTxt:
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of the probation sentence as to Case# 22CF01421 and if no new crimes are committed.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)

Court sentenced defendant to serve  120  DAYS  in the House of Correction with credit for  120  days; TIME SERVED.  

-  Defendant to pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation imposed as to Case# 22CF01421.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of probation imposed as to Case# 22CF01421.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC).

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
This case is assigned to Branch 1.
Case called on the record in Branch 28 on today's date.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Hearing scheduled before Branch 1 on July 27 is vacated from that calendar.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather not in court, in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant has a felony case and Atty. Harris is negotiating for a global offer.  Court authorizes transfer of the case to Br. 25 for resolution only.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court via Zoom, defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Harris has received discovery and an offer and would like time to review it with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  

This hearing will be streamed live on

Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
